column4: Is there a log kept somewhere of the information dumped during a kernel panic?
Since my update to latest Ubuntu with 2.6.38 kernel I keep getting kernel panics whenever wpa_wpa_supplicant tries to establish the network connection.
it's written to /var/log/syslog or /var/log/messages, if the panic still left the kernel in a state that it's able to do so.
Unfortunately it's in neither of those files ...
